What are Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies?

Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies are currencies backed by one or more asset currencies, with a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing the liquidity pool. These currencies are part of the Verus DeFi protocol, which ensures simultaneous pricing and solving of all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block, addressing MEV and front-running issues.

ne Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols. ## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity. ## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge) - Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well. ## An interoperable, multichain network for new use cases and unlimited scale** - The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains, which are easy to setup with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization and onto their internal private netwo
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
How does the Verus DeFi protocol address miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running?

The Verus DeFi protocol addresses MEV and front-running by ensuring that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This prevents miners from extracting value by reordering transactions or front-running, providing a fair and secure DeFi experience.

What are bridge converter currencies?

Bridge converter currencies are a type of fractional basket currency that is bound to the launch of a new blockchain. They have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but run on the new blockchain and generate fees that are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain.

How do blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches work on Verus?

What is the significance of the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network, and what are its benefits?

The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows for the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. This enables the creation of public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains, which are easy to set up with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization and onto their internal private network. The benefits of this approach include unlimited scale, interoperability, and easy setup of private blockchains.

How do blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches work in Verus, and what are the benefits?

In Verus, blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches allow for setting required minimum levels of worldwide participation in preferred currencies on-chain. If minimums are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically get a refund of all their pre-conversions, less network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price-neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations.

What is the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network, and what benefits does it offer?

The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows for the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains, which are easy to set up with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization and onto their internal private network. This network offers unlimited scale and new use cases for blockchain technology.
